Dating: 23RD DYNASTY (not before); 25TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not after)
Name: Canopic jar with lid
Description: Canopic jar with lid in the shape of a jackal's head. The vessel's body, with its high inconspicuous shoulder, tapers from the wide rim towards the base, its walls only slightly curved. On the inside, about two-thirds of the vessel has hollowed out. The exterior surface, with the exception of the bottom, has been well polished, the interior is still rough.
